name: Lying Rotator Cuff Exercise
how_to_perform:
# Lying Rotator Cuff Exercise
1. Lie on your back with the affected arm lying across your stomach and a pillow or pad under your other arm to stabilize it.
2. Hold the arm in place with your opposite hand, making sure that you're not holding onto any part of your body.
3. Slowly begin to lift your top arm up and out to the side until it's at a 90-degree angle from your torso.
4. Continue to engage your core muscles and keep your bottom arm stable throughout the exercise.
5. Return slowly to the starting position, keeping control over your movements.
6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The lying rotator cuff exercise is a strength training movement targeting the rotator cuff muscles and is generally performed lying down with arm stabilization
alternative_names: External Rotations on a Swiss Ball
